tasks.subject: Study how TypeScript CLI apps are created and tested
Initialize the project
tasks.description: Initialize the project with TypeScript, Rollup, ESLint and Prettier.

tasks.subject: Create a test to test that the app prints it's name with the current version when it is run from the command line
tasks.description: Add and configure jest, create the test using node:child_process.execSync(), and edit pclock.ts so that the test is passed.

tasks.subject: Designing the basic structure of the application a little
tasks.description: Going through and editing the previous README.md.

tasks.subject: A new project timesheet can be created
tasks.description: Create tests for testing that the command 'new' works and edit the code so that the tests are passed. Use the commander library for the implementation and study how the library is used. Previous test for argumentless call had to be rewritten too.

tasks.subject: Clock can be started and stopped
Clock can be paused and unpaused
Subject and description of the task can be set and edited
Command 'status' lists started but incomplete tasks and number of complete and incomplete tasks
Tasks can be added without starting the clock
